About Me

Shraey Bhatia

Shraey here - an upcoming Data Scientist with an interest in Deep Learning and Machine Learning. I recently graduated with my Masters degree from the University of Melbourne. Data fascinates me and I truly believe this is the century where data and predective modelling will take us to the next level. Have any interesting Projects or Research ideas, well then let us get in touch.

My Skills

My Projects

Some of my projects. I have linked a few of them to github as well. Feel free to check it out. Rest of them will be up shortly.

NETL

In this project I employed neural network inspired Doc2Vec and Word2Vec models in conjunction with topic models to give a labelling approach for topics. Hence given a bunch of topic words it will generate a succint phrase or label for those words representing the idea. Thhis project was part of my work at IBM Research and you can also find the reseach paper in the publications section.

Finding Donors for Charity

This Project notebook employed supervised learning where NGOs reached out only to people earning more than $50,000 hence not wasting resources on others. Then try to predict individual’s income using attributes like education level, capital gain, occupation, age, working-class etc. FInally apply Ada Boosting and ensemble methods to achieve an accuracy of 86%.

Creating Customer Segments

In this project, we will analyze a dataset containing data on various customers' annual spending amounts (reported in monetary units) of diverse product categories for internal structure. One goal of this project is to best describe the variation in the different types of customers that a wholesale distributor interacts with. Doing so would equip the distributor with insight into how to best structure their delivery service to meet the needs of each customer.

Link Pediction between Twitter Users

Predict the presence of links between Twitter users, given data in the form of a directed social network graph. The graph of network was transposed into a binary classification problem. Supervised learning techniques were applied along with different Ensemble approaches. Finally, Gradient Boosted Trees with feature transformation achieved an accuracy of 85%.

Video and Image Q/A System

In this project we break Video into image frames, train Cov-nets using inception3 architecture on time distributed layer and combine them with LSTM layer. We use pre-trained word2vec vectors on word queries and combine them with using LSTM layer. Finally, Concatenate output of both LSTMs, add a couple fully connected layer and an output layer to softmax and give predictive words for the Video.

Predicting Boston Housing Prices

In this project, I will evaluate the performance and predictive power of a model that has been trained and tested on data collected from homes in suburbs of Boston, Massachusetts. A model trained on this data that is seen as a good fit could then be used to make certain predictions about a home — in particular, its monetary value. This model would prove to be invaluable for someone like a real estate agent who could make use of such information on a daily basis.

Text Generation with LSTM

In this project I use LSTM recurrent neural network for text generation in Python with Tensorflow and Keras. I train stacked LSTM network on text sequences an then use this trained sequences as a generative model to generate new text sequences.
